solution_line_template: There are {num_dog_walkers} dog walkers and they each have {legs_per_walker} legs so that's {num_dog_walkers}*{legs_per_walker} = <<{num_dog_walkers}*{legs_per_walker}={walker_legs}>>{walker_legs} legs

The other dog walker is walking {other_walker_dogs} dogs that each have {legs_per_dog} legs so that's {other_walker_dogs}*{legs_per_dog} = <<{other_walker_dogs}*{legs_per_dog}={other_dogs_legs}>>{other_dogs_legs} legs

The dog walkers have {walker_legs} legs and the other dogs have {other_dogs_legs} legs for a total of {walker_legs}+{other_dogs_legs} = <<{walker_legs}+{other_dogs_legs}={total_known_legs}>>{total_known_legs} legs

There are {total_tangled_legs} legs total and {total_known_legs} belong to the dog walkers and 3 dogs so that leaves {total_tangled_legs}-{total_known_legs} = <<{total_tangled_legs}-{total_known_legs}={mariel_dogs_legs}>>{mariel_dogs_legs} legs
Dogs have {legs_per_dog} legs and there are {mariel_dogs_legs} legs so Mariel is walking {mariel_dogs_legs}/{legs_per_dog} = {mariel_dogs_count} dogs
